p: The average values of the tensile strength (ST) and elongation at break (EB) of different coated PE films are shown in Figure 1a, b, respectively. As the results show (Figure 1a), the highest ST was related to the control film (27.95 MPa), and coating of PE films with different levels of carvacrol and menthol led to a significant reduction in the ST of produced films ( p <.05). So that the lowest amount of ST was obtained in films containing the highest level of carvacrol and menthol (2% level) (23.24 and 22.46 MPa, respectively).
